#Text=Ontario Votes 2007 : Interview with Family Coalition Party candidate Joel Kidd , Beaches-East York
#Text=Tuesday , October 2 , 2007
#Text=is running for the Family Coalition Party in the Ontario provincial election , in the Beaches-East York riding .
#Text=Wikinews ' Nick Moreau interviewed him regarding his values , his experience , and his campaign .
#Text=Stay tuned for further interviews ; every candidate from every party is eligible , and will be contacted .

#Text=Expect interviews from Liberals , Progressive Conservatives , New Democratic Party members , Ontario Greens , as well as members from the Family Coalition , Freedom , Communist , Libertarian , and Confederation of Regions parties , as well as independents .
#Text=Interview
#Text=Why have you chosen to involve yourself in the political process ?
#Text=Why did you choose to run in this constituency ?
#Text=I care about the future of my homeland , Ontario , and I believe Ontario badly needs leaders of moral integrity , who stand on principle for what they believe .

#Text=I am running to give the voters of Beaches-East York a candidate to vote for who sands for moral integrity , accountability , justice , defending the family , defending life , and fiscal responsibility .
#Text=What makes you the most desirable of all candidates running in the riding ?
#Text=There is no other candidate running to represent the need for historic moral principles and ethical integrity to government , who will defend life and defend the family .
#Text=These issues of justice matter far more than issues of finances and budgets , but no other party has the courage to say so and stand on a principled moral foundation .
#Text=In short , only the Family Coalition Party has what that Ontario needs .
#Text=What do you feel are the three most important issues to voters in your riding ?
#Text=Are these the same top three issues that are most important to you ?
#Text=What would you do to address these issues ?
#Text=Government 's number one priority is justice , and there is a glaring , tragic injustice happening in Ontario : abortion .
#Text=It 's our Darfur , our hidden genocide .
#Text=Learn the truth here : http://www.silentnomore.ca/
#Text=The Family Coalition Party will compassionately seek to provide ways to end this tragedy for unborn babies it kills , and for the men and women it hurts .
#Text=How can the province lead the way in stimulating job creation ?
#Text=By reducing the red tape and tax burdens , wherever possible , and encouraging innovation .
#Text=When it comes to the government , less is more -- less is better .
#Text=This is a lot of non-essential spending that needs to be eliminated to reduce the burden on taxpayers .
#Text=What are your views on the mixed member proportional representation ( MMP ) referendum ?
#Text=There is no question that our current electoral and parliamentary system is dysfunctional .
#Text=Ontario needs electoral reform !
#Text=I have weighed the pros and cons to MMP , and I believe it will lead to a healthier political environment in Canada .
#Text=What role , if any , does " new media " play in your campaign , and the campaign of your party ?
#Text=( websites , blogs , Facebook , YouTube videos , etc )
#Text=Do you view it as beneficial , or a challenge ?
#Text=Alternate media is a benefit because it de-centralizes the control of media , it gives freedom to the flow of ideas , a necessary ingredient of a healthy society .
#Text=Alternate media means the decentralization of idealogical and political power .
#Text=Missed questions
#Text=Note that Joel did not reply to these five questions :
#Text=" What prior political experience do you have ?

column1: #Text=" Are the property taxes in your riding at a fair level for the amount of services received in the municipality ? "
#Text=" Of the decisions made by Ontario 's 38th Legislative Assembly , which was the most beneficial to your electoral district ?
